meanings.definition: Having berries or resembling a berry.
meanings.sent1: The baccated bush in the garden looked very colorful.
meanings.sent2: The forest was full of baccated trees during the autumn season.
meanings.sent3: The baccated cupcakes at the party were a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were baccated from the cold wind outside.
meanings.sent5: The baccated necklace she wore sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The baccated branches of the cherry tree were heavy with fruit.
meanings.sent2: The baccated shrubs along the path attracted many birds.
meanings.sent3: The baccated hat she wore made her look like a walking garden.
meanings.sent4: The baccated fields stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The baccated jam tasted sweet and tangy on the toast.
